meanings.definition: To come forth; to issue from a source.
meanings.sent1: The warm sunlight was emanating from the horizon.
meanings.sent2: The flowers were emanating a sweet fragrance.
meanings.sent3: The giggles of the children were emanating from the playground.
meanings.sent4: Hope was emanating from her words, filling the room with positivity.
meanings.sent5: The music was emanating through the speakers, creating a joyful atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: The emanating light illuminated the dark room.
meanings.sent2: The emanating heat from the fire kept us warm.
meanings.sent3: The emanating aroma of freshly baked cookies made everyone hungry.
meanings.sent4: The emanating energy of the crowd was contagious.
meanings.sent5: The emanating colors of the sunset painted the sky in hues of orange and pink.
